item.title: Why I Built Reader
item.dc:creator: Ravi Atluri
item.description: Google Reader shut down in 2013. I've been looking for a replacement ever since.
item.content:encoded:
Google Reader shut down in 2013. I've been looking for a replacement ever since.

The alternatives never felt right. Most required accounts, subscriptions and didn't have the simple three-pane layout that made Google Reader so efficient.

So I got Claude & Friends to build Reader.

What It Does

Reader is an RSS feed reader that runs entirely in your browser. No accounts. No servers storing your data. Your subscriptions live on your device, in IndexedDB.

The interface should feel familiar: folders and feeds on the left, article list in the middle, reading pane on the right. Navigate with your keyboard. Press j and k to move between articles. Press ? to see all shortcuts.

Getting Started

Click the + Add Feed button in the sidebar. Paste a URL. Reader figures out the rest.

Organize your feeds into folders. Star articles you want to revisit. Everything stays local, loads fast, works offline.

That's it. No onboarding flow. No feature tour. Just an RSS reader that gets out of your way.

item.title: How to Use Reader
item.dc:creator: Ravi Atluri
item.description: Reader is designed for keyboard-first navigation. Learn these shortcuts to read efficiently.
item.content:encoded:
Reader is designed for keyboard-first navigation. Learn these shortcuts to read efficiently.

Navigation

KeyAction
jNext article
kPrevious article
g aGo to all articles

Article Actions

KeyAction
mToggle read/unread
sToggle star
oOpen article in browser

View Controls

KeyAction
[Toggle sidebar
fToggle focus mode
vToggle view mode
iToggle iframe view

Other

KeyAction
rRefresh all feeds
?Show keyboard shortcuts
EscClose dialogs / exit focus mode

Managing Feeds

Adding Feeds

Click the + Add Feed button in the sidebar or use the feed management dialog. Paste any website URL - Reader will automatically find the RSS feed.

Organizing with Folders

Create folders to group related feeds. Drag and drop feeds between folders, or assign them when subscribing.

Import/Export

Use OPML import to bring in subscriptions from other readers. Export your subscriptions anytime to back them up or move to another app. OPML export is available in the feed management dialog.

Tips

  • Use focus mode (f) for distraction-free reading
  • Star important articles to find them later
  • The iframe view (i) shows the original website when article content is truncated
